file_content.text: Remarkable. The beast appears to have gone into hibernation and shed its shin. The amount of blood it's letting is astounding.
Gross! The thing went to sleep and shed its skin. It's oozing blood and nastiness all over the place.
[You dip your hands in the beast's blood and rub it into your armor. Hopefully this is what the ritual requires.]
I've never seen a beast bleed so much. It seems we are to literally bathe in the demon's blood.
The beast's stench is thick on us. It makes my eyes water.
It will pass, Captain.
No big deal.
I'm not concerned.
I think you'll survive.
Stop bellyaching.
I'll contain my commentary, even if I can't contain the smell.
You don't fool me, Quinn, you're crying.
You're emotionally affected.
Dealing with the beast was an impressive experience, but it does not move me.
I believe we have succeeded in the Demon Blood ritual. Are we to move on to the Sand People compound, my lord?
Immediately.
Lead the way, my lord.
If you have more to say, we can just sit around and wait until you're done.
When you stop talking.
Point taken, my lord.
When I'm good and ready, Captain.
I will decide.
Of course, my lord. I will follow faithfully.
Oh yuck! So much blood--if I knew we were gonna literally bathe in it, I would have waited outside.
And this smell! Gag! We're gonna stink for days. What if it never wears off?
It will be alright, Vette.
Don't worry.
I sure hope you're right. I take a lot of pride in my hygiene.
If the smell doesn't wear off, you'll offend the nose as well as the ears.
Then you'll be extra annoying.
Sorry, I hate to complain, but this is beyond unacceptable.
I could cut off your nose if you like.
I can make it worse.
No, uh, that's alright. I'm sure I'll get used to it. Yeesh.
So, let's get out of this stink pit, huh?
Calm yourself, Vette.
Patience.
Okay, I'm trying.
You took the words out of my mouth.
I agree.
Lead the way.
We'll leave when I'm good and ready.
I will decide.
Sure, fine, don't mind me.
[You dip your hands in the beast's blood and rub it into your armor. Hopefully this is what the ritual requires.]
[An ancient sand demon is in the far corner of the cavern. It has not noticed you yet.]
My lord, permission to speak. I have thoughts about our present undertaking.
Speak, Captain.
Go ahead.
Your timing is unfortunate, Quinn.
Now?
Just a quick assessment, my lord.
I think it's adorable how you look out for my well being.
You're cute when you worry.
Respectfully, you are my commander, and it is my duty to offer any assistance I can.
I'm not sure what the Padawan could have done to avoid a physical confrontation with the sand demon. No doubt some Jedi mind manipulation.
But if a girl nascent in the Force can quell the beast, surely we can. And then we can slaughter the monster with ease.
Are you concerned about facing the sand demon?
Do you doubt we can win?
An unknown enemy is always a concern. But I've seen you overcome fearsome foes before.
If the Jedi succeeded without killing, I must try.
We fight as a last resort.
You are my general, I will back you up.
I can slaughter the demon without any tricks.
I prefer a straight-up fight.
Of course, my lord. I only sought to help you explore all options. Whatever happens, I have your back.
When I seek input, I'll ask for it.
Save it.
My apologies, my lord.
It seems the time is upon us. The demon has caught our scent.
Uh, can we talk for a second? I really don't have a good feeling about this.
I need you focused here, Vette.
Hold it together.
I'll make you feel better later.
[Flirt] Don't worry, beautiful.
Uh, we're about to face a monster that can swallow us whole.
Walking into a demon's lair not your idea of fun?
Danger doesn't excite you?
Sorry. I just have an irrational aversion to attacking monsters that can swallow me whole.
I'm thinking, if the Jedi performed the Demon Blood ritual without a fight, there must be a way we can too.
As a favor to me, could we please get through this without mixing it up with the sand demon?
We'll see, Vette. I'll try.
Maybe.
That's all I ask. Thank you.
I was already planning on doing that.
That is my intention.
Oh good. That's a relief.
Looks like it's showtime. The monster's caught a whiff of us. I'm ready to back you up if it goes badly.
I never avoid a fight.
No way.
Right, I forgot. Subtlety is not in the Sith dictionary.
Looks like it's fight time. The beastie's caught a whiff of us.
How does this feel, slave?
Do I care? [Shock Vette]
Yeeeeooooow! Brilliant making me scream out like that. Now the demon's marked us.
Not now. You'll spook the beast.
Save it.
All right, sorry. I guess it's not important.
Uh-oh, I think the demon's got a whiff of us. Sorry!
[The sand demon is clearly incensed at your intrusion. You sense that it will attack in an instant.]
Forget subtlety, the beast must die!
[Attack the sand demon]
[The sand demon growls.]
Desert monster--I stand my ground! I will not run!
[Stand stoically]
[You sense confusion. The sand demon hesitates.]
Submit or be punished!
[Raise a fist]
See, I am not your enemy.
[Put hand out to be sniffed]
[The sand demon shakes off its confusion and attacks.]
Look into my eyes, beast.
[Stare the sand demon down]
[You sense submission. The demon cowers.]
We are one, at peace.
[Close eyes and meditate]
I show my back to demonstrate my dominance.
[Turn away dismissively]
[You sense trust. The sand demon lowers its defenses and falls asleep.]
The beast sleeps. Now, let us see what transpires.
[Watch and wait]
[The sand demon glows and sheds its skin. Blood oozes from the beast all over your shoes. The overwhelming stench fills the air of the cave.]
The beast has been cowed. Easy prey now!
[Kill the defenseless beast]
[The sand demon dies.]
You are now my pet.
[Pat the sand demon]
[The sand demon becomes furious and attacks!]
I yield to you, demon.
[Step back submissively]
[The sand demon senses weakness and attacks!]
